description:
Understanding job requirements, defining work and employer expectations allows for better performance, increased satisfaction of accomplishments and retaining talent in the business. While performance expectations are established in company handbooks, being able to draw out employee expectations is a newly required skill for managers, demanding communicating articulately clearly defined set of presuppositions, setting specific measurable goals, agreeing on progress evaluation dates, being resourceful about alternatives, and avoiding third hand information and innuendos. Following open door policy, praising publicly and criticizing privately, considering contingencies, using feedback surveys and behavioural profiles to raise employee self-awareness, encouraging open, constructive dialogues are dynamic tools for clarifying employee expectations.


The course include the following video topics:

1. Model for Learning and Devlopment

2. Types of On-the-job training

3. Evaluation of development activities.

4. Competency-based development.

5. Assessment and development centers

6. Career Development and Planning

7. Talent management

8. Sample succession planning chart


A few word about the author of this course:

Tania Ayerst has over 20 years of experience in Management Consulting and over 15 years in the area of People Management and Development. Her expertise includes Strategic Management, Agile/Lean management, Strategic Human Capital Management, Customer Relations, Organizational Culture Change, Employee Engagement, Performance Management, Competency Modelling, Total Rewards Management, Learning and Development, Talent Management, HR Transformation, etc.

She help companies re-think and re-design their culture and organization using NEO-MANAGEMENT. This is a group of new management methods, based on new paradigm. It is better suited to the contemporary hyper-competitive, totaly connected market.
